Subscribe to Adblock Plus filter lists
Including custom filters and marked ads

Via supports almost all Adblock Plus filters. 
You can block requests from example.com with a filter such as: 
||example.com^ (or simply: example.com) 

Wildcard is acceptable such as: 
||example.com/js/ads_*.js 

For webpage elements use a filter such as: 
example.com###ad 

You can unblock special requests with a filter such as: 
@@||example.com^
Built-in filters only block common ads
You need to agree and accept all the terms before you start using our service.
The account deletion request has been submitted.
Delete the account from the server

After submitting the deletion request, the account will be logged out and enter a 15-day deletion waiting-period. If you log in to the account again and upload data during the waiting-period, your deletion request will be withdrawn. After the waiting-period expires, the account and related data will be completely deleted from the server.\nPlease enter your password to submit the request.
Force dark operation for web contents
When enabled, webpages will be forced to darken, which may cause some pages to behave abnormally.
This will take effect if JavaScript is enabled.

When enabled, the X-Requested-With and X-Wap-Profile headers will be empty, which may cause some pages to behave abnormally
The title can not be empty
The user-agent can not be empty

Metadata block
The metadata must follow the format:
// ==UserScript==
// @key value
// ==/UserScript==

@name: The name of the userscript.

@namespace: The combination of @namespace and @name is the unique identifier for a userscript.

@match/@exclude-match: Define rules to decide whether a script should be executed. It is recommended to use @match instead of @include.

@include/@exclude: The old way to decide whether a script should be executed.

@version: The version of the userscript.

@description: The description of the userscript.

@author: The author of the userscript.

@require: The require of the userscript. For example,
// @require https://my.cdn.com/jquery.js.

@run-at: Decide when the script will execute. document-start is used to inject scripts before the page loads, document-end is used to inject scripts after page load, document-idle is used to inject scripts after page is idle.

@grant: Specify which special GM_* APIs should be granted and can be used when the script executes.


@downloadURL: The URL the script can be downloaded from.

@supportURL: The support URL of the userscript.

@homepageURL: The homepage URL of the userscript.

GM_* APIs
GM_* are a group of special APIs provided by Via. Currently supported special APIs include:
GM_getValue/GM_setValue/GM_deleteValue/GM_listValues/GM_getResourceText/GM_getResourceURL/GM_addElement/GM_addStyle/GM_setClipboard/GM_xmlhttpRequest/GM_download/GM_registerMenuCommand/GM_unregisterMenuCommand.

Matching
@match defines a URL matching rule. @exclude-match defines a match rule but used to exclude the matched URLs, similar to @exclude.

For example:
// @match https://www.google.com/something
// @match https://www.google.com/any/*
// @exclude-match https://www.google.com/any/not_me

Be careful, ignoring ssl certificate warnings may make connection to website insecure

SSL certificates are used to verify website identities and encrypt connection. It\'s like putting a letter in an envelope and posting it, only you and the website can open envelope and read the letter.\n\nOnce you ignore the SSL warnings, the connection to the website may be insecure, which means that the data transmitted with the website may be stolen. It\'s like putting the letter in a broken envelope and posting it, someone who forged the certificate could open it.
I know this may make connection insecure
Safe browsing allows WebView to protect against malware and phishing attacks by verifying the links
